intro: Sium aberdarensum, commonly known as the Welsh waterdropwort, is a rare flowering plant native to the UK. It is characterized by its slender, erect stems and small, greenish-white flowers that appear in clusters. The plant thrives in damp, shaded environments such as woodland floors and wet meadows. Its leaves are typically heart-shaped and have a rough texture. Sium aberdarensum is listed as a priority species due to its declining population and ecological significance.
